verses.text: 保羅闡明他的權柄與工作我保羅與你們見面的時候是謙卑的，不在你們那裡的時候，卻是放膽的。現在我親自以基督的謙遜溫柔勸你們，

words.note: Often refers to spiritual or governmental authority.
Lit. 'release courage'; implies boldness or confidence.
Often associated with Christ's character.

verses.text: 求你們使我在你們那裡的時候，不要滿有自信地放膽對你們，我認為要以這樣的自信，勇敢地對付那些以為我們是照著世俗的標準（「世俗的標準」原文作「肉體」）行事的人。

words.note: Lit. 'release courage'; used here adverbially.
Often implies non-spiritual or earthly.
Often implies non-spiritual or earthly.
In Bible, often refers to human sinful nature.

verses.text: 我們雖然在世上行事，卻不是按照世俗的方式作戰，

words.note: Often implies non-spiritual or earthly.

verses.text: 因為我們作戰所用的兵器，不是屬於這世界的，而是在　神面前有能力的，可以攻陷堅固的堡壘，

words.note: Used before a verb to form a noun phrase meaning 'that which is V-ed'.
Honorific space before 'God'.

verses.text: 攻破詭辯，和做來阻擋人認識　神的一切高牆，並且把一切心意奪回來，順服基督。

words.note: Refers to cunning or fallacious reasoning.
Indicates the preceding action is for the purpose of the following.
Honorific space before 'God'.
Used figuratively here.
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
Refers to the inner mind or will.

verses.text: 我們已經準備好了，等你們完全順服的時候，就懲罰所有不順從的人。

words.note: Used as a resultative complement indicating completion.
Often used in religious contexts for submission to divine will or authority.

verses.text: 你們看事情，只看表面。如果有人自信是屬於基督的，他就應該再想一想：他是屬於基督的，同樣，我們也是屬於基督的。

words.note: Reduplication of verb (V-一-V) to soften or indicate brief action.

verses.text: 主把權柄賜給我們，是為了要造就你們，不是要破壞你們，就算我為這權柄誇口過分了一點，也不會覺得慚愧。

words.note: In a biblical context, refers to God or Jesus Christ.
Often refers to divine or delegated authority in religious texts.
A formal term for giving, often implying a superior granting to an inferior.
In biblical contexts, means to spiritually strengthen or improve.

verses.text: 不要以為我寫信是用來嚇你們。

words.definition: used for, for the purpose of

verses.text: 因為有人說：「他的信又嚴厲又強硬，他本人卻其貌不揚，言語粗俗。」

words.note: Used to link parallel adjectives or verbs.
A classical idiom, lit. 'his appearance not prominent'.

verses.text: 說這話的人要想一想，我們不在你們那裡的時候，信上怎樣寫，我們來到的時候也會怎樣作。

words.note: Reduplication with 一 indicates a brief or tentative action.
Forms a noun phrase from the preceding clause.
Indicates location or aspect (e.g., 'in the letter').

verses.text: 我們不敢和那些自我推薦的人相提並論；他們拿自己來量自己，拿自己來比自己，實在不大聰明。

words.note: Idiomatic expression meaning 'to mention in the same breath'.
不大 means 'not very'.

verses.text: 我們所誇的，並沒有越過範圍，而是在　神量給我們的界限之內；這界限一直延伸到你們那裡。

words.note: Indicates the object of the following verb or a nominalized action.
Often used in formal or classical expressions like '...之内' (within...).

verses.text: 如果我們沒有到過你們那裡，現在就自誇得過分了；但事實上，我們早就把基督的福音傳到你們那裡了。

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'.

verses.text: 我們並沒有越過範圍，拿別人的勞苦來誇口。我們盼望隨著你們信心的增長，我們的界限就因你們而大大擴展，

words.note: Reduplication of '大' (big) for emphasis, meaning 'greatly'.

verses.text: 使我們可以把福音傳到你們以外的地方。別人在他的界限以內所完成的工作，我們不會拿來誇口的。

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'
Often precedes a verb to emphasize the action or agent.
Indicates purpose or direction after a verb.
Here, indicates 'something to' or 'a matter of'.

verses.text: 誇口的應當靠著主誇口，

words.note: Forms 'the one who boasts' or 'those who boast'.
Refers to God or Jesus Christ.

verses.text: 因為蒙悅納的，不是自我推薦的人，而是主所推薦的人。

words.note: Often passive: 'to be granted acceptance'.
Forms 'the one who is accepted'.
Refers to God or Jesus Christ.
Often precedes a verb to emphasize the object of action.
